title: One Direction's fifth album finally has a title: Made In The A.M.
content:
One Direction have announced that their much-anticipated fifth album will be titled Made In The A.M and released globally on Friday, November 13. 
 
The album, which is available to pre-order now, was unveiled via a video message. 
 One Direction (Charles Sykes/Invision)  
It follows the massive success of Drag Me Down, the first single lifted from Made In The A.M, which topped the UK singles chart, climbed to third spot in the Billboard Chart in the US and broke streaming records globally. 
 [embedded content] 
To celebrate the launch of Made In The A.M, One Direction have released Infinity, a track from the album, as a special surprise for anyone who pre-orders the album or streams through online retailers. 
  
The guys have an exciting announcement for you… https://t.co/J2IdOIJSYD 
 
— One Direction (@onedirection) September 22, 2015 
 
The song, a rousing slice of guitar pop, is written by John Ryan, Jamie Scott and Julian Bunetta, the team behind One Direction smash Story Of My Life. 
  
So our new album is called Made in the A.M. Can't wait for you all to hear it ! 
 
— Liam (@Real_Liam_Payne) September 22, 2015 
 
Showcasing a more mature sound for the band, Infinity is a taster of what to expect from the forthcoming album. 
 
One Direction will kick off the UK and Irish leg of their On The Road Again Tour with six nights at London’s O2 Arena from Thursday, September 24, as well as headlining the Apple Music Festival at the Roundhouse in London tonight supported by special guests Little Mix. 
 
Niall Horan tweeted his excitement about the gig: 
  
Camden its Gona be fun tonight ! Who's coming down ? 
 
— Niall Horan (@NiallOfficial) September 22, 2015 
 
Both One Direction and Little Mix found fame on The X Factor with the boy band having gone on to enjoy global success, acquiring millions of fans who are known as ”Directioners”. 
 [embedded content] 
Little Mix, who won the ITV talent show in 2011, have also had success on both sides of the Atlantic. 
 
Last month the band hit the headlines over rumours about their future – shocking millions of devoted fans. They have confirmed they are taking a break. 
 
Unsurprisingly the news had fans taking to Twitter to voice their excitement.
